properties.text: Records on your wall
properties.label: Shop now

properties.text:
We are a family-owned design company based in Denmark in the heart of Odense. The concept of a frameless display system for vinyl records came out of our passion for music and vinyl records, and because of the fact we had a lot of old records hanging around in our basements.

We design and produce what we think is the world's greatest products for displaying records in the home like you do with art and paintings. Actually, Twelve Inch is as much a way of thinking about records and music in general, as it is tangible products. Our mission is to nurture and grow the love for vinyl records, by providing a flexible and elegant way to display your vinyl records on the wall. We believe that caring for and listening to vinyl records contribute positively to life quality. The almost ceremonial act of playing a record can itself be quite meditative, and listening to music this way demands focus and time, forcing one to wind down completely.

Our products allow you to display your records on the wall without any frames or visible parts. The true genius of our solutions is however the flexibility they offer, allowing you to easily change your records out, keeping your display setup fresh and dynamic. You can get really creative when you combine our products as well. You can display the records in a gallery side by side, with their cover still on, gatefolds can be opened up to display the front or back cover artwork, you can display the vinyl only, or half inserted into the cover, or combine the vinyl record with its cover and inner sleeves. It‚Äôs really up to you and your imagination.
properties.headline: Our Story

properties.text: We are all about supporting local businesses, so head to our ‚Äòfind a store near you‚Äô page to find out, if your local record store has Twelve Inch products on stock. If you‚Äôve found a store that isn‚Äôt stocking our products, maybe you could encourage them to do so. Thanks üôè
What if I want to support my local record store?

properties.name: A. Flynn
properties.text: This did exactly what I needed it to. It displays my records subtly without marring my walls too much. It was easy to mount and use.
properties.headline: Invisble record hanging

properties.name: Sabrina
properties.text: These are impressive. I was looking for a way to display vinyl as art and didn‚Äôt want to buy expensive frames. Please make it look like they are floating on the wall. Plus you can still access the album if you want to listen to it.
properties.headline: These make it look like they are floating on the wall

properties.name: Chris Cammarata
properties.text: Works great and looks pretty cool
properties.headline: Five Stars

properties.text:
Our products allow you to create a stunning and personal record gallery on the wall without any frames or visible parts. The true genius is however the flexibility our solutions offer, allowing you to easily change your records out, keeping your display setup fresh and dynamic. Display the records side by side, with their cover still on, open up gatefold albums to display the front and back cover art work, display the vinyl only, or combine the vinyl record with it‚Äôs cover and inner sleeves. It‚Äôs really up to you and your imagination.

 

Our mission is to nurture and grow the love for vinyl records, by providing a flexible and elegant way to create amazing record galleries in the home.
properties.headline: Decorate your walls with Mac Demarco and Father John Misty
properties.subheadline: ‚Ä¶ or whoever your favorite artist might be.

properties.answer: Reach out to us at info@twelve-inch.com, any of our social media platforms or the chat function of this website.
properties.question: Do you have any other questions not mentioned above?

properties.answer: In our product packaging, we include a screw for you to use when mounting the products on the wall. This is the recommended way. Consider to use a raw plug if your wall is pure drywall. Fast travel to the ‚ÄòHow to mount‚Äô instructions page to know more.
properties.question: How do you mount the products to the wall?

properties.answer: Easily! Our products are designed to hold single record albums, gatefold albums and double record albums with ease. You have to mount the product correctly on the wall, and insert the 12‚Äù disc nearest the magnet to ensure a maximum strength and hold. See our instructions of use for further information.
properties.question: Can your products hold 180 grams records?

properties.answer: We are working on ways to reduce our impact on the natural environment and the use of natural resources. All natural materials used in our products now are sourced from environmentally responsible companies. The paper used in the products and it‚Äôs packaging is FSC certified and the ‚Äúplastic‚Äù in the new version of the Original is made of a nonpolluting, truly biodegradable bamboo compound material. The design of the products and the packaging is centered around minimizing the amount of used materials. We recognize the importance of reducing pollution in the production of the products, which is why we have urged our partners to use clean renewable energy only. We wish to do more down the line.
properties.question: What is your policies regarding sustainable production and environmental care?

properties.answer: If you use our products as they are intended and don‚Äôt exceed the strength of our magnets, you can expect that your records will keep on the wall and won‚Äôt fall. Make sure that your gatefold albums doesn‚Äôt open up while on the wall, cause it will put extra weight on the magnets. Avoid situations where wind can blow on the albums, and knock them down. Use one of the methods for displaying gatefold albums described above. Follow our How to mount guide and read the Instructions of use, just to be safe.
properties.question: Is there any chance that my record will fall to the ground and get damaged?

properties.answer: Yes! Our magnets are strong enough to hold double record albums on the wall with ease. However, some deluxe versions might be too bulky or heavy for our products, so please be very cautious when you try to display your deluxe albums or heavy records in general.  We recommend using the same methods as with a gatefold album (read the answer above) to ensure a great hold. Follow our How to mount guide and read the Instructions of use, just to be safe.
properties.question: Can your products hold heavy deluxe versions?

properties.answer:
You absolutely can! There are different ways to do so, depending on the actual gatefold album, and wether it is closed in the left side or not.

If you have a gatefold album that has a left side wing that is closed, you can either a) display the album with the back showing or b) display the album in a clear plastic sleeve.

If you have a gatefold that has both wings open, you can either a) display the record opened up using two Twelve Inch Original, b) store the vinyl records somewhere else (perhaps using the Twelve Inch packaging cover) and mount the Twelve Inch disc in the outer wing or c) display the album in a clear plastic sleeve.
properties.question: Can I use gatefold records with your products?

properties.answer:
Yes. You must absolutely avoid mounting your records on a spot on the wall where direct sunlight will hit the records for an extended period of time. The rays of the sun can warm a record to temperatures that harm the vinyl records, making them crooked. And while we all know that warped records sound funny, it would be a shame to lose your favourite records to the heat of the sun.

On the contrary, you must avoid really humid conditions as well, as the humidity will cause the covers of your album to warp.

In general we recommend that you change the records on display often, as to avoid any warping of the cover, and off course, to keep the display collection exciting and new.
properties.question: Is there any other situations I must avoid?

properties.answer: Our products doesn‚Äôt have any permanent or long term effect on your records, either their antistatic properties or sound qualities. It‚Äôs correct that magnetism effects vinyl records, especially their antistatic load. However, as soon as you remove the record from the magnetic display component, the antistatic load will return to normal within milliseconds.
properties.question: I‚Äôve heard that magnetism affects vinyl records in a negative way, among other things making them less antistatic resulting in loss of sound quality.

properties.answer: You can buy them directly on our web-shop on this site, on most Amazon market places and in some brick and mortar record shops. Visit our ‚ÄòFind us here‚Äô page to know more.
properties.question: Where can I buy your products?

properties.answer: No, absolutely not. If you follow our ‚ÄòHow to mount‚Äô guide and ‚ÄòInstructions of use‚Äô, you can be sure the our products won‚Äôt harm your records in any way. One tip is to make sure that you slide the record off of the magnetic disc, when you want to take down the record. Always handle your records with care.
properties.question: Does your products harm my records in any way?

properties.answer: Please don‚Äôt. One might be succesful with using strong double sided tape, but through trial and error, and a lot of testing, we have found that this method is insufficient. Our experience is, that the tape will at some point let go of the wall or the product, and the unspeakable happens to your vinyl records.
properties.question: Can I use double sided tape, instead of the provided screw?

properties.answer: You can return the product within 30 days. Just fill out our return-form here. No questions asked :)
properties.question: What is your return policies?

properties.answer: We value and respect your private data. They belong to you, and should stay with you. It is essential that we collect some of your personal data, like name, address, telephone number etc. in order to fulfill your orders. These kind of information will only be shared with us, if you choose to place an order, sign up for our newsletter or use our chat function. You can ask us to disclose which data we store about you or delete your data entirely at privacy@twelve-inch.com
properties.question: What is your GDPR policies?

properties.answer: Our products use magnetism and clever design to secure your records to the wall. The magnetic component is secured to the wall with a screw and looks like a black disc. A large 12‚Äù disc looking like a vinyl record with a metal disc fitted in the middle is then inserted into your record, thus creating a magnetic attraction.  If you want to wall mount your vinyl records, with it‚Äôs cover on, you will have to use the Twelve Inch Original. If you wish to mount only the vinyl record itself, you should use the Twelve Inch Adapter.
properties.question: How does your product work?

properties.answer: We only use cookies that you approve of. If you want to change your cookie preferences, you can do it here.
properties.question: What is your cookie policies?

properties.answer: We are a family owned design company based in Denmark in the heart of Odense. The concept of a frameless display system for vinyl records came out of our passion for music and vinyl records, and because of the fact that we had a lot of old records hanging around in our basements. The records where unplayable because of age and deterioration, so we had to find another use case for them. Displaying them on the wall means that you can use old records as an interior design element, much like traditional art work, but the history of your particular record collection - where it came from, when you bought the records, the eras and stories they represent - all comes alive when displayed on the wall. Read more here.
properties.question: Who are Twelve Inch?

properties.text:
We are a family-owned design company based in Denmark in the heart of Odense. The concept of a frameless display system for vinyl records came out of our passion for music and vinyl records, and because of the fact we had a lot of old records hanging around in our basements.

We design and produce what we think is the world's greatest products for displaying records in the home like you do with art and paintings. Actually, Twelve Inch is as much a way of thinking about records and music in general, as it is tangible products. Our mission is to nurture and grow the love for vinyl records, by providing a flexible and elegant way to display your vinyl records on the wall. We believe that caring for and listening to vinyl records contribute positively to life quality. The almost ceremonial act of playing a record can itself be quite meditative, and listening to music this way demands focus and time, forcing one to wind down completely.

Our products allow you to display your records on the wall without any frames or visible parts. The true genius of our solutions is however the flexibility they offer, allowing you to easily change your records out, keeping your display setup fresh and dynamic. You can get really creative when you combine our products as well. You can display the records in a gallery side by side, with their cover still on, gatefolds can be opened up to display the front or back cover artwork, you can display the vinyl only, or half inserted into the cover, or combine the vinyl record with its cover and inner sleeves. It‚Äôs really up to you and your imagination.
properties.headline: Our Story

properties.text:
We‚Äôll try to answer all of your questions below, but if we are unsuccessful, please do not hesitate to reach out to us on the mail below, visit one of your local retailers or get in touch on our chat function. Don‚Äôt be polite - ask us all of your savy questions. 

Borgerv√¶nget 14, 1sal
5000, Odense C, Denmark
info@twelve-inch.com

First, spray the record

Cover up the label of your record with the included protection mat, and spray the record with the G2 fluid. Wait a few seconds to allow the fluid to reach deep in to the grooves

Second, whipe away

Gently use the leading edge of the pad to wipe around the record in concentric circles, in line with the grooves.  Avoid wiping across the grooves.

Alternatively

Place the record on your turntable, turn it on and gently wipe around the record in concentric circles, in line with the grooves.
When we set out to create the perfect solution for displaying records on the wall, we had one requirement: it should be easy to use and install on the wall. We think we nailed it (pun intended).
HOW TO
When we set out to create the perfect solution for displaying records on the wall, we had one requirement: it should be easy to use and install on the wall. We think we nailed it (pun intended).
HOW TO

A single album

Display a single album behind your turntable to show, what you‚Äôre currently spinning. Works well with regular single albums.

Gatefold albums

We love to display gatefold albums opened up, like on the picture above. You‚Äôll enjoy the full experience of the album cover art this way.

Display records with their album covers

Create amazing record galleries with the records and their respective album covers displayed side by side. You‚Äôve never experienced the full art work of your records like this before.

Multiple albums

Create a record gallery with multiple albums on display, and come up with different themes for the gallery. Display your favourite jazz albums, hip-hop classics, or the records with the coolest cover art work.

Records on its own

With the Twelve Inch Adapter, you can display your favourite records on the wall.

First, mount the magnet to the wall

Use the included screw to mount the magnet to your wall. Please use a raw-plug if you‚Äôre mounting the product on a dry wall.

Second, insert the white disc

Insert the white disc into the record, you‚Äôll like to display on the wall. Place it, so it‚Äôs nearest to the wall magnet. If you‚Äôre displaying a gatefold album, insert one white disc into each wing of the album.

Lastly, adjust and enjoy!

Put the record up against the wall magnet, and only let go when you feel it's secured to the wall. Adjust the record, take a step back and enjoy! It‚Äôs this simple.

When taking down the record from the wall magnet, it‚Äôs recommended to slide the album down, rather than to pull the record. Insert the white disc into the record in the back of the album cover. With the white disc in the record, you can now put your record on the wall.

First, mount the magnet to the wall

Use the included screw to mount the magnet to your wall. Please use a raw-plug if you‚Äôre mounting the product on a dry wall.

Screw on the adapter piece

Screw on the adapter piece on the record, you'll like to display. Check that it's screwed on thigtly - but don't over tighten the adapter piece either.

Lastly, rotate and enjoy!

Carefully put the record on top of the wall magnet. Rotate the record clock wise to find the best attraction. Slowly let go of the record, making sure it's secured to the wall. Finito!
When we set out to create the perfect solution for displaying records on the wall, we had one requirement: it should be easy to use and install on the wall. We think we nailed it (pun intended).
HOW TO

Display one record

Display a single record behind your turntable to show what you‚Äôre currently spinning. Works well with all types of records, from singles, to LP's to picture discs.

Records display

One way to truly show off your funky sides, is to display multiple colored records side by side.

Combine records and album covers

Create amazing record galleries with the records and their respective album covers displayed side by side. You‚Äôve never experienced the full art work of your records like this before.

When you first visited this site, we asked you through a cookie consent widget which cookies you‚Äôll allow us to install in your browser. These cookies are essential for delivering a great service and providing a user friendly website. You may always update your cookie preferences here.

We use analytics tools to understand user behaviour, in order to deliver a great website experience and relevant marketing. A cookie installed in your preferred browser is what powers these analytics tools. To learn about what these cookies does and what data they collect about you, please read through the following documents:

Google Privacy Policies
Facebook Privacy Policies

We use Google Analytics to understand the behavior of the users of our website, and Facebook Business tools to optimize our web-shop and deliver relevant ads.
Data Collection

The information provided by Twelve Inch Aps (‚Äúwe,‚Äù ‚Äúus‚Äù or ‚Äúour‚Äù) on https://twelve-inch.com (the ‚ÄúSite‚Äù) is for general informational purposes only. All information on the Site is provided in good faith, however we make no representation or warranty of any kind, express or implied, regarding the accuracy, adequacy, validity, reliability, availability or completeness of any information on the Site.

The use of products designed and produced by Twelve Inch Aps acquired through our web-shop on this site, https://twelve-inch.com, or through our wholesale partners or third party shops, is entirely at your own risk. Under no circumstance shall we have any liability to you for any loss or damage of any kind incurred as a result of the use of our products, the site or reliance on any information provided on the site. Your use of the products and the site and your reliance on any information on the site is solely at your own risk.Using our products as intended should be enough to avoid damage to your records or any other property, but you do so at your own risk. 

It is entirely your own responsibility to ensure that the walls you intend to use for displaying your records on is suited for mounting your records to. The included screw is a suggested screw only, and you will use it at your own risk. Likewise, under no circumstances shall we have any liability to you for any loss or damage to you or your walls or any other property as a result of the use of our products and the information on our site.
Disclaimer
Privacy Policy

We value your privacy and the data that is connected to you, and recognize the responsibility that we have towards you, and the protection of your data, when you give them to us. In the following we try to explain what data we collect, how we use it and how you can control the data, we store about you.

We collect certain data about you whenever you use a form, comment on a post and use our web-shop functionality on this web-site (twelve-inch.com). The data we collect can include your name, address, email address(es), telephone numbers etc.

We collect these data about our users to deliver a user-friendly and secure shopping experience. We need the data to receive payments from our users, fulfill the orders and calculatr shipping rates, to authenticate users of the B2B section of the web-shop and manage B2C web-shop orders. You can always ask us which data we have stored about you and demand that we delete them. Use this mail address to let us know: privacy@twelve-inch.com.
Last updated on 1st of May 2020
Company Information & Address

Please direct any questions you have at the email address below. We are here to help you as best we can. To return a product, you'll have to fill out our return-form. Download it here and then print it out and include it with the products, you wish to return. Please re-use the shipping packaging that came with the product, and send it to the address below. If you bought the product on Amazon, either as a redirect from our web-shop or directly with Fullfilled By Amazon, you‚Äôll have to make a return to the Amazon shop you bought it from. 

Twelve Inch Aps

5000, Odense C, Denmark
info@twelve-inch.com

CVR. NR.: 38417517
Liability

IN NO EVENT WILL WE OR OUR DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, OR AGENTS BE LIABLE TO YOU OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOST PROFIT, LOST REVENUE, LOSS OF DATA, OR OTHER DAMAGES ARISING FROM YOUR USE OF THE SITE AND OUR PRODUCTS, EVEN IF WE HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
Return and refund Policy
You can return the products within 30 days, at your own expense, with no questions asked. You‚Äôll get a full refund, if the product is in the same conditions, as when you received it.

You hit a dead end, my friend. This page signals that you have either misspelled the name of the web address you where searching for, or we made a huge mistake and messed up a link somewhere. 

If you think we made a mistake, be kind and report it to us at info@twelve-inch.com. Thanks in advance!
properties.headline: Bummer!

properties.text:
Vinyl records are probably one of the most sustainable products ever made. The records that you or your parents bought back in the 70s still last today. Invented decades ago and deemed obsolete, vinyl records now resurfaces with a remarkable comeback and actually trumps digital media downloads in a lot of countries. No wonder, records are superior to digital media in every sense. But more on that later.

Seven years ago I dusted off my old collection of vinyl records in a moment of nostalgia. As the memories came pouring down on me, an idea formed in my mind.

I thought that it was a shame, that these records had been sentenced to a life of solitude in the basement of my home. How could I bring back life to these old records, if they were not to be played on a record player? Could they be displayed in my home in such a way, that they would remind me of my passion for music every day? The answer of course was sure! The records could be displayed on the wall, just as we do with paintings and other artwork. I searched the web and the local record stores for solutions to my problem, but only found unappealing and pricy products. Thus the desire to come up with the perfect solution for displaying records on the wall.
A wish to bring back life to our old records, inspirered us to design a simple solution for displaying records on the wall
How we became Twelve Inch
Corporate Responsibility / Sustainability
Simplicity and Danish design philosophy
Our mission

Our mission is to nurture and grow the love for vinyl records, by providing a flexible and elegant way to display the records on the walls like art and paintings. We believe that caring for and listening to vinyl records contribute positively to life quality. The almost ceremonial act of playing a record can itself be quite meditative, and listening to music this way demands focus and time, forcing one to wind down completely.

If we are not careful, the art of listening will be forgotten, the interest for high fidelity audio will fade away, and in return, the art of music will become less important to the artists. Let‚Äôs work together to ensure, this does not happen.

We hope that we can help people rediscover their old vinyl collections, just the way it happened for us when we dug up the old records. Or perhaps spark an interest in quality music in young people.

We believe that taking care of our earth and all shared resources on it has to be a part of the business model. We are therefore exploring new methods of production and alternative materials to determine the most sustainable way of producing and selling our products. All paper materials used in our current line-up is FSC certified, including the packaging and shipping packaging. We are however looking for solutions to cut down on the general use of natural materials, to reduce our impact on our environment.

The basic idea for the design of the product came together over long talks, while listening to records and drinking coffee with our friends, going through the pros and cons of displaying records on the wall. We all agreed on several critical design features the finished product should include.

No frames or visible brackets.

It should be very simple and quite natural to want to change the records on display.

Simple but flexible design - a lot of ways to display your records.

Through a lot of trial and error, and a proof of concept with strict self-imposed goals, we settled on the current design. And we really think we have come up with the ultimate solution for displaying records and their cover on the wall. In a simple way, we use magnetism to keep your records on the wall without the need for frames and visible brackets. This is really the genius of our products. It allows you to display your records on the wall and swiftly change them out, always keeping your display setup fresh with your latest acquired records. You can display the records in a gallery side by side, with their cover still on, gatefolds can be opened up to display the front or back cover artwork, you can display the vinyl only, or half inserted into the cover. It‚Äôs really up to you and your imagination.

We are very proud of the versatility and flexible design of our products. We hope that you agree, that Twelve Inch products is the best way to display records on the wall. And that our solutions pays great respect to the art of making great music records.

We are a family-owned design company based in Denmark in the heart of Odense. The concept of a frameless display system for vinyl records came out of our passion for music and vinyl records, and because of the fact we had a lot of old records hanging around in our basements.

 

Our mission is to nurture and grow the love for vinyl records, by providing a flexible and elegant way to display your vinyl records on the wall. We believe that caring for and listening to vinyl records contribute positively to life quality. The almost ceremonial act of playing a record can itself be quite meditative, and listening to music this way demands focus and time, forcing one to wind down completely.
properties.headline:
We're Twelve Inch

A danish family owned design company
properties.subheadline: And we believe there's another layer to vinyl records - they can become your personal art work gallery

properties.text:
Our products use magnetism and clever design to secure your records to the wall. The magnetic component is secured to the wall with a screw and looks like a black disc. A large 12‚Äù disc looking like a vinyl record with a metal disc fitted in the middle is then inserted into your record, thus creating a magnetic attraction.  If you want to wall mount your vinyl records, with it‚Äôs cover on, you will have to use the Twelve Inch Original. If you wish to mount only the vinyl record itself, you should use the Twelve Inch Adapter.

Our products doesn‚Äôt have any permanent or long term effect on your records, either their antistatic properties or sound qualities. It‚Äôs correct that magnetism effects vinyl records, especially their antistatic load. However, as soon as you remove the record from the magnetic display component, the antistatic load will return to normal within milliseconds. If you follow our ‚ÄòHow to mount‚Äô guide and ‚ÄòInstructions of use‚Äô, you can be sure the our products won‚Äôt harm your records in any way.

We are working on ways to reduce our impact on the natural environment and the use of natural resources. All natural materials used in our products now are sourced from environmentally responsible companies. The paper used in the products and it‚Äôs packaging is FSC certified and the ‚Äúplastic‚Äù in the new version of the Original is made of a nonpolluting, truly biodegradable bamboo compound material. The design of the products and the packaging is centered around minimizing the amount of used materials. We recognize the importance of reducing pollution in the production of the products, which is why we have urged our partners to use clean renewable energy only. We wish to do more down the line.

properties.headline: Five Stars

properties.name: Travis
properties.text: I recently purchased the Twelve Inch - Invisible Display Bracket for Vinyl Records for a close friend of mine. I always saw my friend set his vinyl albums covers on display as he listened to a given record. This product allows you to very easily mount display the album you are listening to through a clever use of magnets. He no longer has to set his album covers to lean against the wall, or behind the record player. There is quite a great aesthetic as well that displays the album color as a seamless work of art. My friend was very pleased and promptly sent me a photo upon receiving the Twelve Inch. I have posted his photo below. I highly recommend this product if you listen to vinyl, know someone who does, or want to display album art.

properties.headline: Five Stars

properties.text: Create amazing record galleries with the Twelve Inch Adapter. Display the records side by side, or combine with the record jackets to show the full artwork.

You can display your coloured vinyl records or special edition picture discs, with the Twelve Inch Adapter. Display them in a fascinating gallery style grid side by side, or combine records with their record jackets to display the full artwork of your favourite records.

 

Best thing about this product? You can change the record that‚Äôs on display in a second!
properties.title: Twelve Inch Adapter

properties.name: Sabrina
properties.text: These are impressive. I was looking for a way to display vinyl as art and didn‚Äôt want to buy expensive frames. Please make it look like they are floating on the wall. Plus you can still access the album if you want to listen to it.
properties.headline: These make it look like they are floating on the wall

properties.name: Joan R. Morabito
properties.text: Easy to put up, although we did 6‚Äù between the albums. Used some two sided tape on double album covers. The rest are all good. We ended up using some tigger screw but overall am so happy! Looks great and my husband likes that he can change what albums go up there!
properties.headline: Excellent service from the company!

properties.name: A. Flynn
properties.text: This did exactly what I needed it to. It displays my records subtly without marring my walls too much. It was easy to mount and use.
properties.headline: Invisible Record Hanging

properties.name: Chris Cammarata
properties.text: Works great and looks pretty cool
properties.headline: Five Stars

properties.name: Travis
properties.text: I recently purchased the Twelve Inch - Invisible Display Bracket for Vinyl Records for a close friend of mine. I always saw my friend set his vinyl albums covers on display as he listened to a given record. This product allows you to very easily mount display the album you are listening to through a clever use of magnets. He no longer has to set his album covers to lean against the wall, or behind the record player. There is quite a great aesthetic as well that displays the album color as a seamless work of art. My friend was very pleased and promptly sent me a photo upon receiving the Twelve Inch. I have posted his photo below. I highly recommend this product if you listen to vinyl, know someone who does, or want to display album art.
properties.headline: Five Stars

properties.text: Records that come straight from the factory, contains left over sediments from the production. To really enjoy the best audio quality of your records, we recommend to clean your newly acquired records before playing them.

Treat your turntable to a nice cork mat, which not only looks cool but will improve the audio quality by providing better tightness and definition  to the music. 

 

Cork is a sustainable material aswell. Win win!
properties.title: Twelve Inch Cork Mat

properties.text: Create amazing record galleries with the Twelve Inch Original. Display the records side by side, or open up gatefold albums to show the full artwork.

The Twelve Inch Original will enable you to display your records on the wall without any frames, parts or brackets showing. Display your favourite cover art in your home on your walls side by side, in a custom grid that you decide, or perhaps in conjunction with the Twelve Inch Adapter. It‚Äôs all up to you!

 

Best thing about this product? You can change the record that‚Äôs on display in a second!
properties.title: Twelve Inch Original

properties.text: Records that come straight from the factory, contains left over sediments from the production. To really enjoy the best audio quality of your records, we recommend to clean your newly acquired records before playing them.

Record cleaning kits doesn't get much better than this. The advanced record cleaning fluid effectively gets rid of both new or old dirt and debri, which can pile up deep in the grooves of your records.

 

The walnut handle is made from American walnut tree, and the wiping pad can be changed out with a new one easily.

 

If you care about the audio quality of your records, you should clean and maintain them with this Twelve Inch GrooveWasher kit.
properties.title: Twelve Inch GrooveWasher
